result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel C. Colby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI 8th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the department. 
Court finds defendant is not entitled to any days sentence credit.
Court finds defendant eligible for SAP and not eligible for CIP.
CORRECTED: OWI assessment fee added 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superTimeConds.notes: Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name, as it the defendant himself.

Associated with Charge #1
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:08 am 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (OWI 8th)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty O'Neill makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 8 years imprisonment to run consecutive to any other sentence def is currently serving - 4 years IC and 4 years ES; $3000 plus costs; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 years, as is the defendant himself; 3 years dl revocation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES: AODA, absolute sobriety from alcohol; assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the def eligible for SAP and NOT eligible for CIP. 
COURT remands def to the custody of the sheriff for transport to WI State Prison System.

Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
